summary: A new survey released by the Lowy Institute think tank in Sydney showed that 72% of respondents said they didn't trust Trump to act responsibly in global affairs . When asked whether Trump or Xi would be a better partner for Australia, the two leaders were tied at 45% apiece . The results come as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese attends a Group of Seven meeting in Canada .  Australians’ faith in the US has deteriorated following the president’s return to the White House . Trust in America as a global player has fallen to just 36%, by far the lowest result in the Lowy survey's 20-year history . Despite an aversion to Trump, Australians aren’t ready to move away from the US as their primary security partner . The survey showed consistent support for the US alliance, with 80% of respondents saying America was important for Australia's security .  The $7 billion Nicotine-Pouch Market’s Next Target? Applying AI to digital ad buying could be huge for The Trade Desk’s investors and customers . The world is gearing up for artificial intelligence (AI) Researchers believe AI could unleash between $15 trillion and $23 trillion in annual economic value by 2040 .  Apple's iOS mobile operating system spans phones, accessories, watches, tablets, and computers that all work seamlessly together, creating a formidable competitive moat . The more iOS devices you use, the more of a pain it is to abandon the system for something else .  There's a solid chance that Apple will eventually work out these kinks and deploy its consumer-facing AI technology across billions of devices . The company is a behemoth today, and probably won't grow fast enough to replicate its past investment returns . The stock has become a slower and steadier grower with a rising dividend, making it an ideal investment .  The Trade Desk operates a buy-side platform that companies and ad agencies use to purchase ad space ideally suited for targeting demographics . It is currently migrating clients from its old platform, Solimar, to its AI-driven Kokai platform . Research and Markets predicts a CAGR of 14% between 2022 and 2030 for the digital advertising industry .  In the first quarter of 2025, The Trade Desk reported $616 million in revenue, a 25% increase from year-ago levels . Still, since that amounts to revenue of just under $2.6 billion over the trailing 12 months, the company claims well under 1% of the addressable market .  Robinhood Markets is one of the fastest-growing brokerages, with revenue increases of 50% . Robinhood's AI initiatives are an under-the-radar asset that could grow in importance in the coming years .  Robinhood's Cortex, an AI investment tool, plans to roll out later this year . The company hopes to grow its assets under management (AUM) to more than $200 billion . In retail investing, customers will come to expect personalized analysis and advice . The best Buffett AI stock should benefit tremendously as organizations build and deploy AI models in the cloud . Berkshire Hathaway owns only two AI stocks . Buffett has invested roughly $90 billion in nine companies that are heavily focused on AI .  Berkshire owns around $2.1 billion of the e-commerce and cloud service giant's shares . Amazon Web Services (AWS) has been a big winner as organizations scrambled to build and deploy AI models in the cloud . Amazon is also using AI extensively internally to increase efficiency .  Only AI stocks owned directly by Berkshire Hathaway . Apple is the only AI stock in both Berkshire's and NEAM's portfolios . Google parentAlphabet and Microsoft are profiting from the strong AI tailwind .  Alphabet is arguably the most attractively valued AI stock in the group, with growth prospects factored in . I think the best Buffett AI stock all-around is Amazon. The company is poised to profit as more organizations move their apps and apps .  Amazon is expanding into new markets, including healthcare, autonomous ride-hailing, and satellite internet services . Amazon still has significant growth prospects in e-commerce as well . Wedbush analyst Daniel Ives reaffirmed his Outperform rating on the stock, along with a $270 price target . Ives noted that while the presentation outlined Apple’s vision for the developer ecosystem, it offered limited new detail on the company's artificial intelligence initiatives . Apple appears to be moving cautiously, likely in response to last year's strategic missteps .  Apple may be seen as entering the AI race later than peers, but Ives acknowledged that the company has begun laying the groundwork for a longer-term strategy . 2025 could be a critical year for the company to begin monetizing its AI efforts more visibly . He suggested that if internal development does not accelerate, the company may need to explore larger-scale AI acquisitions . Apple's latest offerings and announcements aren't generating excitement among investors . The company could accelerate earnings during an upgrade cycle . Apple is a fair value for an industry-leading company .  At WWDC 2025, Apple announced new features across Apple products, allowing developers to access the company's on-device large language model (LLM) Apple also unveiled a software interface update called Liquid Glass and a new operating system for many of its products called iOS 26 .  As of Friday afternoon, Apple was down 3.8% compared to its closing price on June 6 before WWDC began . There is no shortage of criticism that Apple is behind on AI and isn't innovating enough . Apple is in a different position than other companies because it is mainly consumer-facing .  Apple is vulnerable to tariffs, as it assembles most of its products in China . If users like Apple's upgrades, they may be willing to pay a higher price for new products . Apple's goal shouldn't be to release the most technologically advanced features, but to blend AI with design and engagement .  Apple's trailing-12-month sales are up just 3.3% in the last three years and diluted earnings per share are up 5.9% compared to a 45.4% increase in the stock price . The most valid reason not to buy Apple stock is its lackluster earnings growth .  A big chunk of this group likely bought devices during the pandemic and is due for new devices in the coming years . Another factor is Apple's relentless capital return program . Apple's board of directors approved a $100 billion stock buyback program in May . Buybacks have helped Apple grow EPS far faster than net income over the years .  Apple could undergo a considerable earnings expansion in the coming years . Buybacks will help the company grow earnings even during periods of slower growth . All told, I expect Apple to outperform the S&P 500 in the second half of 2025 . Apple renewed its dividend in 2012 . The company produces plenty of free cash to support dividends . In the first six months of the current fiscal year, Apple's FCF totaled $47.9 billion .  Apple raised its May quarterly dividend by a penny to $0.26 per share . To receive $1,000 in yearly dividends, you'd have to purchase 962 shares . Using the June 9 closing price of $201.45, those shares will cost about $194,000 . With a 0.5% dividend yield, investors will hope capital appreciation will provide the majority of Apple's total return .
